narrative.title: 50Th Infantry Division - 1943Q1
narrative.situation: British infantry_division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q1.
narrative.objectives: Main assault division for XXX Corps frontal attack on Mareth Line. Division led Operation Pugilist (19 March), penetrating Italian 136th Armoured Division 'Giovani Fascisti' near Zarat. Established bridgehead west of Zarat 20-21 March before 15th Panzer Division counterattack destroyed pocket 22 March.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Mareth Line - Wadi Zigzaoug anti-tank ditch, fortified defensive positions, minefields. Coastal sector of Mareth defenses. Rocky terrain with extensive fortifications.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Veteran division - continuous combat since El Alamein
Strong anti-tank capability with new 17-pounder guns
Combined arms coordination with attached armour

environment.terrain_type: Mareth Line - Wadi Zigzaoug anti-tank ditch, fortified defensive positions, minefields. Coastal sector of Mareth defenses. Rocky terrain with extensive fortifications.
